keyEvents.title: Luffy Attempts to Reach Noah
keyEvents.description: Luffy launches himself toward the massive ship Noah's chains in an attempt to stop it from destroying Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: Noah becomes the primary battleground for the climactic confrontation.

keyEvents.title: Hody Reaches Noah's Deck
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones reaches Noah's deck first and stabs Vander Decken, intending to deactivate his powers and drop the ship onto Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the site of Hody's betrayal and the potential instrument of Fish-Man Island's destruction.

statusHistory.description: Noah is being used as a weapon to destroy Fish-Man Island

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Swims to Save the Island
keyEvents.description: Shirahoshi makes the brave decision to swim into the open ocean to lure Noah away from Fish-Man Island and save her people.
keyEvents.significance: The entire island's population faces potential destruction from Noah.

keyEvents.title: Underwater Battle Near the Island
keyEvents.description: The ocean surrounding Fish-Man Island becomes the battleground for Luffy's fight against Hody Jones.
keyEvents.significance: The battle determines whether the island will be saved or destroyed.

statusHistory.description: Fish-Man Island faces imminent destruction from the falling Noah

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Departs from Palace
keyEvents.description: Shirahoshi uses the palace gateway to leave the protective air bubble and swim into the open ocean.
keyEvents.significance: Shirahoshi leaves the safety of her home for the first time in years to save her kingdom.
